overview:
Terry is responsible for operations,  software architecture and corporate strategy at Monstro.  Prior to Monstro, co-founder Jeff Fedor and Terry launched ParkVu and developed and launched Music WithMe, the first product in the world to wirelessly sync music from iTunes to a smartphone.  The application worked on any platform or device and was named by the CTIA one of the 2009’s most promising new mobile products or applications.  The company was also the first to enable a user to share their iTunes library with their friends on Facebook.

Earlier, Terry was the VP of Software Development at PostRank, which was acquired by Google in 2010.  Previously Terry held senior software engineering positions at Primal Fusion (formerly Terapath, Inc.) and Sandvine Corporation, where he led software development teams and was responsible for technical due diligence of prospective acquisitions.   

His commentary has appeared in WIRED, Music Alley, Digital Music News, Engadget, and The Wall Street Journal.

His first business experience came when he repaired and sold 8086 and 286 computers from his parents’ basement at the age of 12.  In high school he founded G-Tek System and built and sold custom PCs to consumers.  Terry attended Western Kentucky University on a track and cross country scholarship where he studied computer science. He was most recently named one of Louisville, Kentucky’s 40 under 40.
